Generate a 2D sketch on `face_1` of the coordinate system, then create the following components: - Loop: - Circle: - Center: [0.375, 0.375] - Radius: 0.375 3. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the Euler angles and translation vector. 5. Extrude the 3D model by 0.0136 using the normal direction. Part 2: Smaller Cylinder Create a small cylinder on top of Part 1. 1. Create a new coordinate system using these settings: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.1705, 0.3068, 0.0136] 2. Generate a 2D sketch on `face_1` of this coordinate system with these components: - Loop: - Circle: - Center: [0.0682, 0.0682] - Radius: 0.0682 3. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.1364. 4. Part 3: Cylindrical Prism with Diagonal Hole Model a cylindrical prism with a cylindrical hole through its center. 1. Create a new coordinate system with these settings: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.3068, 0.0614, 0.0136] 2. Generate two 2D sketches on `face_1` and `face_2` of the coordinate system: - Sketch 1: - Loop: - Circle: - Center: [0.0682, 0.0682] - Radius: 0.0682 - Sketch 2: - Loop: - Circle: - Center: [0.0682, 0.5591] - Radius: 0.0682 3. Scale the 2D sketch on `face_1` and `face_2` by 0.6273. 4. Transform the two 2D sketches into the 3D space using the new coordinate system. 5. Perform a CutFeatureOperation with 0.0341 depth in the opposite direction of the normal. For the final shape, you have created a flat, circular object with three holes evenly spaced around the perimeter. The dimensions and details of the curves, loops, and faces in each part are provided in the description.</description>
